newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Saudi offers full range naphtha at $15/T premium.
newsitem.headline: Saudi offers full range naphtha at $15/T premium.

text.p: Saudi Aramco haS set a target price of $15.00 per tonne for the term sale of 1.3 million tonnes of full range naphtha to Asian customers for July and December 1997 lifting, industry sources said on Wednesday.
But most Japanese term holders were hoping that Saudi Aramco would stick to the price set in the previous contracts.
In the previous January to June 1997 contracts, Saudi Aramco sold its term full range naphtha from Jubail at $5.50 per tonne and from Rabigh at $5.80 per tonne.
Under the new contract, Saudi Aramco is expected to offer 800,000 tonnes of full range naphtha from Jubail and 500,000 tonnes of similar grade naphtha from Rabigh.

For the term sale of its 2.9 million tonnes of A-180 paraffinic naphtha, Saudi Aramco has set a target premia of $17.00-$17.50 per tonne compared to the $6.50 premium it received for its January to June 1997 contract.
They said most Japanese term buyers have submitted bids at premiums between $14-$15 per tonne.
Traders said Hyundai Petrochemical, India's Reliance and Kanematsu Corp have already met with Saudi Aramco officials on the first two days of the term talks that started on Monday.
Saudi Aramco expects to conclude the term discussions with 13 oil firms by Friday, traders said.
Traders involved in the talks said companies were told to get back to Saudi Aramco if they are accepting the offers by the end of the week.
